oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Embroidered postcard U. S. Navy battleship
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The postcard depicts a United States naval ship. "Elmer" and "1918" are written on the front of the card. The reverse of the postcard includes a note from the sender. He mentions getting back "O.K." but he got the ??? for leaving the hospital before the wound was healed. He also states, "that lunch was the best ever and lasted until I hit Albany, N.Y."
